Hi Bill

We have junit tests and java property files. They run in a specific 
sequence and get their data from the property files. That is fine for 
completed tests.
But we need something like a workflow in the tests; eg. test1 creates 
something in the database and test x uses the same data to verify 
some additional testcases.
We started to examine jxunit, unfortunately it is not that well 
documented..

cheers

erik

--- In junit@y..., "Bill Laird" <wlaird@w...> wrote:
> Hi Erik - I'm not quite sure what you are trying to say. Unit tests 
in the classic sense are mutually exclusive from functional tests. 
There may be some overlap in coverage, but there is no union of test 
cases. 
> 
> Is what you are trying to say is that you want to use Junit as a 
framework and harness for black box functional testing of Java API's? 
> 
> 
> Cheers,
> Bill

properties

files

and
